Title: UK govt faces growing pressure over collapsed China spy case
Summary: Charges against Christopher Cash, 30, and Christopher Berry, 33, were dropped . UK government denies it helped scupper a high-profile case involving two men accused of spying for China . It comes under pressure over its stance towards Beijing .

Title: FG recovers N658b, foils arms smugglers in September, says NOA
Summary: Federal Government recovered N658.6 billion in revenue and foiled arms smuggling attempts in September . Director-General of the National Orientation Agency, Lanre Issa-Onilu, made this known on Monday .

Title: FG declares zero tolerance for cybercrime
Summary: Federal Government reaffirms commitment to eradicating cybercrime in Nigeria . Declaration came on Monday during Cybercrime Awareness Walk held in Abuja .

Title: ASUU strike: FG directs VCs to enforce ‘no work, no pay’ policy
Summary: Academic Staff Union of Universities (ASUU) commenced its two-week nationwide strike . The Federal Government has directed vice-chancellors of federal universities to enforce the ‘no work, no pay’ policy . This is coming as members of the Congress of University of Nigeria (Congress of University) began their strike .

Title: Zuma International Film Festival holds Dec 1 to 5 in Abuja
Summary: Zuma International Film Festival is scheduled to take place from December 1-5 in Abuja . The Nigeria Film Corporation (NFC) has concluded arrangements aimed at hosting the festival . Its Managing Director, Dr. Ali Nuhu, disclosed at a press conference .

Title: CSO urges Tinubu to set up monitoring, evaluation team to assess ministers
Summary: Civil Society Organizations on Community Advancement and Humanitarian Empowerment Initiative (CSCHEI) urges Tinubu to set up monitoring, evaluation team to assess ministers . CSCHEi has called on President to establish robust monitoring and evaluation mechanism to assess performance of his ministers .

Title: Alleged investment fraud: Trial of two CBEX promoters suffers setback
Summary: CBEX was one of several digital platforms that collapsed after allegedly collecting billions of naira from unsuspecting investors . The trial of two CBEX promoters suffers setback .

Title: FG moves to empower communities to manage their safety in flood, other disasters
Summary: Federal Government is considering empowering flood-prone communities to manage their own safety . It is part of measures aimed at addressing the growing threat of flood-related disasters nationwide .

Title: Reps move to establish vocational, skills training centres nationwide
Summary: House of Representatives Committee on Alternative Education held a one-day public hearing on four bills . The bills seek to establish vocational and skills acquisition training centres across different parts of Nigeria .

Title: Increase agricultural funding to close yield gaps, boost food security — Minister tells Reps
Summary: Senator Aliyu Abdullahi called for sustained investment and increased funding in Nigeria’s agricultural sector . Minister of State for Agriculture and Food Security called for increased investment . Senator Abdullahi wants to close existing yield gaps in major crops and achieve national food security .
